ratings.question_text: The readings/cases/textbooks used in this course were __________ .
Out-of-class assignments for this course were ___________ to my learning.
The workload for this course in comparison to other courses was ___________.
The pace of this class was ____________ for optimal learning.
Overall, the teaching assistant for this course was accessible, organized, and able to explain concepts clearly and thoroughly.
Field trips were well designed and ran smoothly.
I learned a lot from field trips.
How clearly does the instructor provide explanations of conceptual material?
How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Please identify the teaching assistant with whom you interacted most closely _____________________ .
Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: Most of the homework assignments required the use of basic algebra and trigonometry. As I had never taken an economics class before I would have liked to have had some examples of how to do the problems.

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: Mendelsohn's lectures. He is a great person with a strong passion for environmental economics. I highly recommend him.

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: The wording in the homework problems was always confusing. Also, some of the questions did not even have the right wording. The Teaching Assistants graded all homework problems and midterms word for word. If you did not use the exact word that they were looking for, from their answer key, they would deduct points.

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: There were regular pop quizzes in the discussion section and attendance and participation were mandatory. There was a good relationship between the discussion section and the lectures.

narratives.question_text: What were the strengths and weaknesses of your teaching assistant
comments: Instructor: Stephanie Stefanski  Great TA. Very helpful.

Instructor: Stephanie Stefanski  The number one weakness of Stephanie is that she did not always know understand how to solve the problems in the problem sets or in the midterms. If she missed a lecture and you had a question about that lecture, that was just too bad. I would like to see her make more of an effort to understandthe material so that she can explain it correctly to us. On the other hand, Stephanie was very generous with her time and willing to try to help as much as possible. She just did not encourage a deep or thorough understanding of the material.

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: For a lot of people, money is the bottom line. Economics explains that mentality.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: I took this course to learn the language of economics.

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: I learned more than I ever wanted to know about pollution, renewable resources, and non-renewable resources. I would have liked to learn more about the things that are hard to get an economic value of, such as endangered species. The teacher kind of glossed over that issue.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Go to office hours often. They are the only way to understand what the correct answer is.
